page.title: 03ECOLOGY - Woodland
page.content: Marlpit Oak is a sample of many small copses on heathland. It is dominated by sloe with hawthorn,bramble and bracken. A cluster of oak trees near the road has a sample 13 metres high. On the path from Tile Barn to Boldre the wooded parkland was grazed by a large flock of sheep. Brockenhurst wood is in the care of Hampshire and Isle of Wight Naturalists' Trust. The first 100 metres has a few oak standards underlain by sycamore saplings, ash saplings, hawthorn, bracken and bramble. Further along a 15 metre square in more mature woodland had an oak 15 metres high, 2 other oaks, 1 beech, 2 silver birch, a number of saplings with a ground cover of bracken. On the N. side of the valley in an area of oak and beech there is a 20m. high oak (girth=3.7metres near base).
